root.DebateTimingRubric: Business Question to the Leader of the House

MotionText.from_cdata: A Bill to extend the period during which departmental functions may be exercised in the absence of Ministers to cover the whole of the current period in which there is no Executive; to give the Secretary of State power, during that period, to commission advice and information for the purpose of developing options for raising more public revenue in Northern Ireland or otherwise improving the sustainability of public finances in Northern Ireland; and to require certain accounts and related documents to be laid before the House of Commons in periods in which the Northern Ireland Assembly is not functioning.

root.NumberedHeadingIndented: Progress on reforms to NHS dentistry

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That this House has considered progress on reforms to NHS dentistry.

root.NumberedHeadingIndented: Reducing plastic pollution in the oceans

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That this House has considered the matter of reducing plastic pollution in the oceans.

from_cdata.p: The subjects for these debates were determined by the Backbench Business Committee.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 5.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Political and security situation in Georgia: Adam Holloway
root.DebateTimingRubric: The sitting will last for up to three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1))
root.MotionText: That this House has considered the Third Report of the Justice Committee, IPP Sentences, HC 266, and the Government response, HC 933: Sir Robert Neill

NoteText.from_cdata: The subject of this debate was determined by the Liaison Committee.
